text: No need to apologize, you are asking great questions :smile_cat:
Generally speaking, we are thinking about how to make it easier to have data accessible across environments, as right now non-developer assets do not port quite as easily.
One option for HubDB is to export and then import. Although, the table id will be different
RE: 1. The Raw Assets (more file types in the design manager) is not quite ready. We hope to be ungating beta users soon. I will certainly update here when we are ready to do that
I was about to say that. export the csv and import them to the dev
<@U6W3H6YN8> <@U38EZFVFE> Thanks guys! I guess they are only good questions if i've read the documentation through all the way first.
thats why were here
Thanks
BOOM
So this BETA is a bit different from the zip file I just downloaded?
I use homebrew on my Mac.
I just did this one <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/local-hubl-server>
go here: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/local-development>
Thank you <@UD53A9UUR>
Looks like I need a developers account. I have a free account right now
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/get-started>

While we're at it, I'm actually packaging up a site built mainly with the local dev workflow now. Something that would be a huge help would be a way to move advanced menus to a different portal. Even if it's just the structure and you need to remap the content, just having the tree would be awesome.

I also looked and it doesn't look like there is a menus api though... Was considering just writing an app that would read from one portal and then post to a second. But looks like that's not an option :confused:
or is the thought that menus will be replaced with the new global content editor?

<@UEC65BQV8> Also, I just copied a template that had a module with a HubDB table field, and it copied over the entire table and data as a dependency. You'll need to go into the cloud DM to do it, but I was pleasantly surprised that I didn't need to rebuild my table lol
Sweet! Thanks <@U26BLKGE4>
Friday evening question, I know...is there a list of supported filetypes in the DM that can be uploaded via `upload`
almost anything sans an executible i think
I wonder if this could be done with the api as well.
<@U38EZFVFE> unfortunately I tested a few files types I use aka svg's and woff and they weren't showing up in my DM's
also this:
<https://github.com/teunrutten/HubSpot-boilerplate>
they talk about svg's being a no go
OK, well now its all outta wack. `upload` is doing something strange and suddenly ignoring the folder structure in place and just loading all the html files at the root of the DM
also, no images, png or svg or otherwise
